place.name: CLYDAI
place.gazetteerText: CLYDEY, a parish in the district of Newcastle-in-Emlyn and county of Pembroke; near the Cardigan railway, 5½ miles SW of Newcastle-Emlyn. Post town, Newcastle-Emlyn, under Carmarthen. Acres, 8, 120. Real property, £3, 573; of which £180 are in quarries. Pop., 1, 074. Houses, 245. The property is subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £101. Patron, the Bishop of St. David's. The church was reported in 1859 as bad. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
